moves.7... Qc7 8. d4 Be7 9. dxe5: it is not clear what white got from this exchange.
moves.13... Nxe4: Obvious but even better was cxb first!
moves.14. Qd3 Bxc3+ 15. Ke2 Bxa1: Black is ahead in material and the White king is weak.
moves.23. Qb2 Bf5 24. Rg1 Rad8+: Now Black has a winning attack
moves.25. Kc1: If Ke2, Qc4+ Kf3 Qe4+ Kg3 B-d6+ Bf4 QXB++. But this allows a pretty and instruction combination.
moves.26. b6: Desperation, there are no good moves, but...
moves.26... Qxc2#: This is Checkmate because the Q is pinned.
